I was searching for a Mouse Aim Flight thread for the recent 1.4.x KSP, and found out that the above thread was marked as being "too old".  

Well, March 16 might seem old, but it might be not too old, and since there are no newer maintainence thread, ...

When does a thread turn into a 'dead' thread?  

And even if it says 'create a new thread instead', if it doesn't seem appropriate(especially the case of asking if there are plans for revival/curious about current status for mods or fan-work series, what would be the best thing for me to do (other than having patience...well, I'm not that patient I guess.)?

It is usually not considered a necro if the topic or question is still relevant to the current version of the game or if what you post has current and meaningful contribution to a discussion, no matter how old the thread is.

So it's fine to ask a question in the thread you linked.

Because the thread started a very long time ago, that message is automatically shown to remind people to check that what they're responding to is still relevant.

You'd be surprised how often it happens that friendly and helpful people accidentally answers some question posted in 2012, because they forgot to check the date.
